elements.title: Talabaw (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the soup Talabaw (pictured), which consists primarily of bamboo shoots, is the essential dish of Myanmar's Karen people, who use it to supplement rice?

elements.title: Lord Cottenham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lord Cottenham resigned from MI5 during the Second World War, as he did not support the war with Germany?

elements.title: BK inequality (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the BK inequality was used to identify implausibly lucky Florida Lottery winners, whose involvement in illegal activities was later confirmed by investigations?

elements.title: Meinhard von Gerkan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Deutsche Bahn built Berlin's central railway station according to plans that had been altered against the original architect Meinhard von Gerkan's wishes, he sued them, and won?

elements.title: have played each other (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Argentina and Netherlands national football teams have played each other at every other FIFA World Cup since 1998?

elements.title: Don Luce (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Don Luce led a group of Americans to a secret part of a South Vietnamese prison where inmates were kept in squalor in what were called "tiger cages"?

elements.title: Blemyomachia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Blemyomachia is an epic poem describing a historical clash between the Roman Empire and the Blemmyes in the Nile valley?

elements.title: a big tree (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the city of Palo Alto, California, is named after a big tree?
